title: Airport Rideshare - Essential Procedures and Communication
description: Specialized vocabulary and procedures for airport pickups and drop-offs

criticalVocabulary.spanish: Área de espera TNC / Zona de preparación
criticalVocabulary.pronunciation: AH-reh-ah deh es-PEH-rah / SOH-nah deh preh-pah-rah-see-ON
criticalVocabulary.context: Where drivers wait for airport ride requests (TNC = Transportation Network Company)
GPS boundary and specific location for pickups
Airport levels - pickups at Arrivals, drop-offs at Departures

criticalVocabulary.spanish: A la orilla de la acera / En la banqueta
criticalVocabulary.pronunciation: ah lah oh-REE-yah deh lah ah-SEH-rah

steps.spanish: Entrar al área de espera TNC
steps.details: Free parking lot where drivers wait for requests. Usually within 5-10 minutes of terminals
Uber/Lyft must be in airport mode to receive airport requests
Requests distributed in order of arrival. App shows your position in queue
Higher likelihood of long-distance, higher-paying trips

steps.spanish: Proceder al área designada de recogida
steps.details: Each airport has specific rideshare pickup zones. Follow app directions exactly

findingPassenger.challenges: Airports are chaotic - many people, similar cars, confusing layouts

phrases.english: [Text] I'm in the rideshare pickup area at [terminal/location]. What color clothing are you wearing?
phrases.spanish: Estoy en el área de recogida de rideshare en [terminal/ubicación]. ¿De qué color es su ropa?
phrases.pronunciation: es-TOY en el AH-reh-ah deh reh-koh-HEE-dah

phrases.english: I'm in the [color] [vehicle]. I see you!
I'm coming around again - traffic is heavy
phrases.spanish: Voy a dar otra vuelta - el tráfico está pesado
phrases.context: If you must circle due to airport traffic enforcement

tips: Turn on interior light at night so they can see inside
Wave or flash lights briefly when you see them
Be patient - travelers are often confused and stressed
Use app messaging instead of calling in loud airport environment

luggageAssistance.expectation: Airport passengers often have luggage - helping = better tips

phrases.english: Let me help you with your bags
Where would you like these? Trunk or back seat?

phrases.context: Confirming nothing left behind before departing

oversizeLuggage.scenario: Passenger has more luggage than fits comfortably

phrases.english: I'll do my best to fit everything. If it doesn't all fit, you may need a larger vehicle like an XL.
phrases.spanish: Haré mi mejor esfuerzo para que todo quepa. Si no cabe todo, podría necesitar un vehículo más grande como XL.

oversizeLuggage.note: Can't be penalized for canceling if luggage truly doesn't fit. Take photo if needed

terminalConfirmation.importance: CRITICAL - wrong terminal causes major problems for travelers

phrases.english: Which airline are you flying? Which terminal?

phrases.context: Different terminals often for domestic vs international

terminalConfirmation.verification: Check app destination matches what passenger says. Update in app if wrong

rules: Drop off at Departures level (upper level at most airports)
Cannot stop in most areas - must keep moving
Airport police strictly enforce - tickets expensive
Brief stop only - passenger must exit quickly

phrases.english: I'll pull up right here. Airport security doesn't allow us to wait, so please have your things ready.
phrases.spanish: Me detendré aquí mismo. La seguridad del aeropuerto no nos permite esperar, así que por favor tenga sus cosas listas.

phrases.english: Pop the trunk - I'll get your bags
phrases.spanish: Abra la cajuela - sacaré su equipaje

curbsideDropOff.luggageProtocol: Help unload onto curb. Don't linger. Airport police have no patience

passengerRunningLate.scenario: Passenger is stressed about making their flight

phrases.english: What time is your flight? We'll get you there as quickly and safely as possible.
phrases.spanish: ¿A qué hora es su vuelo? Lo/La llevaré lo más rápido y seguro posible.
phrases.pronunciation: ah keh OH-rah es soo VWEH-loh
phrases.context: Acknowledging urgency while setting safety expectation

phrases.english: Traffic is heavy, but I'll take the fastest route available.
phrases.spanish: El tráfico está pesado, pero tomaré la ruta más rápida disponible.

boundaries.english: I understand you're in a hurry, but I must follow traffic laws for both our safety.
boundaries.spanish: Entiendo que tiene prisa, pero debo seguir las leyes de tráfico por la seguridad de ambos.
boundaries.context: Setting boundary if passenger pressures speeding

constructionChanges.reality: Airports constantly have construction changing pickup/dropoff locations
strategy: Check airport website before first airport trip of day
Don't rely solely on GPS or app - they lag construction changes

multipleTerminals.confusion: Large airports have 4-7 terminals. Wrong terminal = major problem
multipleTerminals.verification: Always ask airline AND terminal. Don't assume app is correct

correction.english: The app shows [Terminal X] but you said [Terminal Y]. Let me update that for you.
correction.spanish: La aplicación muestra [Terminal X] pero usted dijo [Terminal Y]. Permítame actualizar eso.

parkingFees.stagingLot: Usually free, but some airports charge after certain time period
parkingFees.cellPhoneLot: Alternative free waiting area at some airports
parkingFees.shortTermParking: NEVER pay for short-term parking - not reimbursed

queuing.uberPro: Higher tier drivers get priority in airport queue
queuing.lyftPreferred: Preferred drivers advance faster in queue
queuing.waitTimes: Can range from 5 minutes to 2 hours depending on airport and time
queuing.strategy: Check average wait time in app before entering queue. May not be worth it

businessTravelers.characteristics: Experienced, efficient, often in hurry, tip well
businessTravelers.expectation: Professional service, fast efficient trip, minimal chit-chat

phrases.english: I'll get you there efficiently. Feel free to work or relax.
phrases.spanish: Lo/La llevaré eficientemente. Siéntase libre de trabajar o relajarse.

tourists.characteristics: Unfamiliar with area, lots of luggage, may not speak English well
tourists.expectation: Helpful guidance, patience, maybe conversation about area

phrases.english: First time visiting? Let me know if you want any recommendations.
phrases.spanish: ¿Primera vez visitando? Avíseme si quiere alguna recomendación.

families.characteristics: Children, car seats needed, lots of stuff, stressed parents
families.expectation: Patience, help with luggage, accommodate children

carSeats.note: Not required to provide car seats (except in NYC), but passengers must have them

phrases.english: Do you have a car seat for your child? It's required by law.
phrases.spanish: ¿Tiene asiento de seguridad para su niño? Es requerido por ley.

longDistanceTrips.benefit: Airport trips often go 30-60+ miles = high earnings
longDistanceTrips.concern: Return trip with no passenger = unpaid miles
strategy: Turn on rideshare app immediately after dropoff
Consider if area you're going to has good rideshare demand

timing.holidays: Day before major holidays extremely busy - surge/prime time common

airportFees.reality: Platform takes additional fee on airport trips ($3-5 typical)
airportFees.compensation: Usually offset by higher fares from airport

culturalNotes.note: Travelers are often stressed, tired, or anxious. Extra patience and friendliness appreciated
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: Similar stress levels but US travelers may be less openly emotional

culturalNotes.note: Language barriers common. Slow, clear speech and patience essential. Translation apps helpful
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: Your Spanish is asset for Latin American travelers

culturalNotes.note: US culture appreciates but doesn't assume luggage help. Offering proactively earns significantly better tips
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: More formal service expectation than Colombian casual style

culturalNotes.note: Airport passengers tip better on average, especially with luggage help
culturalNotes.colombianComparison: More generous than typical Colombian propina

commonChallenges: LAX: Notoriously confusing, heavy traffic, strict enforcement
JFK: Multiple terminals far apart, construction common
ATL: Massive - can take 15 min just to get from pickup to highway
ORD: Weather delays common, two terminal areas
DFW: Huge airport, long drives between terminals
majorAirportNotes.tip: Research your local airport's specific rideshare procedures. Each airport is different
